body:
I would support @andyleap on this point.

First, I think there is no need to emphasize "interface assignment always makes a copy", for there is no differences between assignments of interfaces values and assignments of other values. It is all the same, all assignments in golang are copies.

Second, the assignments of interface values have nothing related to the values hold by the interface values. Assignments of interface values are just copying the two fields of the interface values. There is no implementation optimizations (not to copy the hold values) made at all.
